title: Patch Generation in APR: A Survey from the Perspectives of Utilizing LLMs and Using APR-Specific Information
data:
Y Yang, C Li, Z Han, R Li, K Xu, Q Li, W Zhong, Z Shen- ACM Transactions on Software
Automated Program Repair (APR) is a crucial task in software development and 
maintenance, aiming to patch software bugs automatically without human 
intervention. The rise of Large Language Models (LLMs) has significantly advanced 
APR. However, as researchers delve deeper into APR as a downstream task for 
LLMs, a key challenge remains: how to effectively integrate APR-specific information 
to complement LLMs capabilities. This survey revisits 124 existing APR studies, most
